class src.edinpy.boson.boson.bosonspace[source]

Bases: object

Create a bosonic Fock space.

build()[source]

Build the fock space basis vectors.

contains(s)
findk(bv)[source]

Programmatically find the index k which generates the next basis vector in lexicographical order. Algorithm statement: Find k such that n_k =/= 0 and n_i = 0 for k+1<=i<=M-1. If there is no such k then n is the last lexicographic basis vector.

Source - J M Zhang and R X Dong 2010 Eur. J. Phys. 31 591

Parameters:

bv (np.array) – a bosonic occupation vector

firstvector()[source]

Generate the first bosonic occupation vector in lexicographic ordering corresponding to the ket bv = |Nb,0,0,…,0> with dim(bv) = Neff.

nextvector(bv)[source]

Find the next bosonic occupation vector in lexicographical order.

Source - J M Zhang and R X Dong 2010 Eur. J. Phys. 31 591

Parameters:

bv (np.array) – a bosonic occupation vector

show()[source]

Print all the basis states.

src.edinpy.boson.boson.clear()[source]

Clear all the degrees of freedom and fock space stored as global variables. It is necessary to call this function when you want to change the model.

Bases: object

Create a bosonic Fock state.

Parameters:

Calculate the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the Hamiltonian.

Parameters:
